dd.p: <fn>. The footnote component is composed of two elements: the cross-reference that calls it, and the actual footnote content.

<span data-class="fn">. The footnote division should have a unique @id attribute. In the body of the text, where the footnote is called from, an internal cross-reference in the form of <a href="#footnote-id"> should embrace the text that you want to make clickable for the footnote.

A footnote is made of two elements: a marker in the text that will become a superscript number; a footnote definition that will be placed in a list of footnotes at the end of the document, following the PHP Markdown Extra syntax for footnotes.

section.title: XDITA example
section.p: The following example demonstrates the use of footnote in an XDITA topic.
section.pre:
Profits, fun, and flavor under the same brand
Initial investment:

$700
Franchise fee:

$200

The initial investment price includes the first franchise fee payment

section.title: HDITA example
section.p: The following example demonstrates the use of footnote in an HDITA topic. In this example, the clickable text is a number 1 in a superscript (<sup>) component.
section.pre:
Profits, fun, and flavor under the same brand

Initial investment:

$7001

Franchise fee:

$200

The initial investment price includes the first franchise fee payment

section.title: MDITA example
section.p: The following example demonstrates the use of footnote in an MDITA extended profile topic.
section.pre:
# Profit, fun, and flavor under the same brand
Initial investment : $700[^1]
Franchise fee : $200
[^1]: The initial investment price includes the first franchise fee payment
